1.description: Now sixteen years old, the age mentioned in the Great Prophecy. Prepares for his birthday knowing it could trigger the prophecy about the fate of Olympus.

4.description: Bathes in the River Styx to gain the curse of Achilles, making his body invulnerable except for one weak spot. Takes this desperate measure to have a chance against Kronos.

8.description: Leads the defense of Manhattan and Olympus against Kronos's army. Coordinates with other demigods, nature spirits, and allies to protect the mortal and divine worlds.

20.description: Realizes the prophecy refers to Luke, not himself. Helps Luke find the strength to destroy Kronos by stabbing his own mortal point, saving Olympus.
20.role: Hero who saves both enemy and Olympus

22.description: Offered godhood by Zeus as a reward for his heroism, but turns it down to stay mortal and be with his friends. Requests that the gods claim all their children.
22.role: Hero who chose mortality over godhood

1.description: Now sixteen years old and still head counselor of Athena cabin. Worried about Percy's approaching birthday and the implications of the Great Prophecy.

4.description: Becomes Percy's anchor point when he bathes in the River Styx. Her connection to him prevents the curse from consuming him completely.

8.description: Helps lead the defense of Manhattan, using her architectural knowledge to plan defensive strategies. Works closely with Percy to coordinate the battle.

16.description: Wounded by a poisoned blade while protecting Percy. Her injury motivates Percy to fight even harder against Kronos and his forces.

22.description: Finally expresses her romantic feelings for Percy openly. Becomes his girlfriend and supports his decision to remain mortal rather than become a god.

8.description: Fully possessed by Kronos, his body serves as the Titan lord's vessel. Leads the assault on Manhattan and Olympus with overwhelming force.
8.role: Kronos's host body and army leader

13.description: Shows brief moments where his original personality breaks through Kronos's control, suggesting some part of him still exists within.

20.description: In his final moments, Luke's true self emerges and he realizes he was the hero mentioned in the prophecy. He stabs his own mortal point to destroy Kronos.

21.description: Dies peacefully after destroying Kronos, finally free from the Titan's influence. His last words are an apology and a request for forgiveness.

6.description: Lieutenant of the Hunters of Artemis, leading them in the battle against Kronos. Her immortality as a Hunter means she won't age to fulfill the prophecy.
6.role: Lieutenant of Hunters in final battle

8.description: Fights alongside Percy in the defense of Manhattan, using her powers over lightning and her skill with weapons to battle monsters and Titans.

16.description: Leads the Hunters of Artemis in coordinated attacks against Kronos's forces. Her tactical experience and immortal warriors provide crucial support.

1.description: Now the leader of the nature spirits after inheriting Pan's essence. Works to rally the wild beings to fight against the forces destroying the natural world.

8.description: Brings an army of nature spirits, dryads, and satyrs to help defend Manhattan and Olympus. His leadership unites the wild creatures in the fight.

16.description: Uses his enhanced powers and connection to nature to help heal the wounded and coordinate with the natural elements during battle.

3.description: Now more confident in his powers over death and shadows. Helps Percy understand the curse of Achilles and guides him through the Underworld.

4.description: Accompanies Percy to the River Styx and helps him understand the risks of bathing in its waters. His knowledge of death magic proves invaluable.

16.description: Brings an army of undead warriors from the Underworld to help defend Olympus. His powers have grown tremendously since his sister's death.

22.description: Finally finds acceptance at Camp Half-Blood and among the other demigods. His contributions to the war effort earn him respect and friendship.

8.description: Now fully possessing Luke's body as his vessel. Leads a massive army of monsters, Titans, and rogue demigods against Olympus in the final war.

14.description: Demonstrates his full power as he battles gods and heroes. His presence begins to unravel the fabric of reality and time itself.

20.description: Finally destroyed when Luke finds the strength to stab his own mortal point, the heel, destroying both himself and the Titan lord possessing him.

2.description: Fighting his own war against the sea Titan Oceanus while his son battles on land. Unable to help directly due to his own battles in the ocean depths.

17.description: Finally defeats Oceanus and arrives to help in the final battle against Kronos. His arrival turns the tide in favor of the gods.

22.description: Extremely proud of Percy's heroism and his choice to remain mortal. Supports his son's request for the gods to claim all their children.

17.description: Finally returns to Olympus after fighting his own battles. Joins the final confrontation against Kronos with his full divine power.

22.description: Offers Percy godhood as a reward for saving Olympus. Impressed by Percy's heroism but initially skeptical of his request regarding unclaimed children.

23.description: Agrees to Percy's request that all gods must claim their children and sends official invitations to Camp Half-Blood for new cabins.

17.description: Finally joins the battle against Kronos after being convinced by his son Nico. Brings the power of the Underworld to bear against the Titan forces.
17.role: Lord of the dead joining final battle

22.description: Agrees to Percy's request to claim all his children and build a cabin at Camp Half-Blood for his offspring.

1.description: Now the Oracle of Delphi, able to see the future and give prophecies. Still maintains her friendship with Percy despite her new role.

5.description: Gives Percy crucial prophecy information and guidance about the coming battle. Her visions help prepare the demigods for what's ahead.

21.description: Delivers the prophecy about the new generation of heroes and the promise of peace, signaling the end of the Titan War era.

2.description: Working as a general in Poseidon's army, leading other cyclopes in the war against Oceanus. Has grown into a powerful warrior and leader.

16.description: Arrives with reinforcements from the sea to help defend Manhattan. Brings weapons he's forged specifically for the final battle.

6.description: Leading the Ares cabin in the final battle. Initially reluctant to fight alongside the other campers due to ongoing tensions.

15.description: Initially refuses to participate in the final battle due to conflicts with the other camps. Her cabin's absence is felt in the defense of Manhattan.

18.description: Returns to join the final battle when her boyfriend Chris is wounded. Leads a crucial charge that helps turn the tide of battle.

5.description: Prepares Camp Half-Blood for the final battle while coordinating with other camps and allies. His experience training heroes proves invaluable.

16.description: Leads the Camp Half-Blood forces in battle, using his archery skills and tactical knowledge to coordinate the defense.

22.description: Witnesses the gods' promise to claim all their children and begins preparations for new campers and cabins at Camp Half-Blood.

9.description: Son of Nemesis who joins Kronos's army, believing the minor gods deserve more respect and recognition from Olympus.
9.role: Minor god's son fighting for recognition

14.description: Fights alongside Kronos in the assault on Manhattan, using his powers and training to battle the defending demigods.

19.description: Dies heroically while trying to stop Kronos, finally realizing that the Titan lord cares nothing for the minor gods or their children.
19.role: Redeemed hero dying for the right cause

6.description: Head counselor of Aphrodite cabin, known for her kindness and her relationship with Charles Beckendorf. Participates in the final battle preparations.

17.description: Revealed to have been Luke's spy within the camp, passing information to Kronos's forces. Her betrayal devastates her friends and allies.

18.description: Dies heroically while impersonating Clarisse to rally the Ares cabin. Her sacrifice redeems her betrayal and helps turn the tide of battle.
18.role: Redeemed hero who died for her friends

1.description: Head counselor of Hephaestus cabin and skilled metalworker. Dating Silena Beauregard and preparing for a dangerous mission against Kronos's forces.

2.description: Dies heroically while destroying Kronos's cruise ship, the Princess Andromeda. His sacrifice significantly weakens the enemy forces but devastates Silena.
2.role: Heroic sacrifice for the greater good

16.description: Head counselor of Apollo cabin and the camp's primary healer. Works tirelessly to heal the wounded during the final battle.
16.role: Head healer and Apollo cabin leader

18.description: Uses his healing powers and medical knowledge to save lives during the intense fighting. His skills prove crucial to keeping the defenders fighting.

7.description: God of dreams who puts most of Manhattan to sleep during the battle to keep mortals safe from the supernatural war.

10.description: His sleep spell affects most humans but some mortals like Rachel can resist it due to their clear sight.

12.description: Ancient Titan of light who leads part of Kronos's army in the assault on Manhattan. Burns with intense golden fire.

14.description: Battles the demigods with incredible power, nearly overwhelming them with his light-based attacks.

16.description: Titan associated with constellations and the south, one of Kronos's brothers leading the assault.

8.description: New York Police Department officers who fall asleep due to Morpheus's spell during the battle.

7.description: Millions of ordinary New Yorkers put to sleep by Morpheus to protect them from the supernatural battle.

9.description: Ancient Titan who brought fire to humans, now serving as Kronos's messenger offering terms of surrender.

10.description: Offers Percy Pandora's jar and tries to convince him that the gods will inevitably abandon their children.
The container that once held all the world's evils, offered by Prometheus as a weapon against the gods.

8.description: Large force of snake-tailed women warriors serving in Kronos's invasion army of Manhattan.
Large numbers of fire-breathing cannibal giants in Kronos's assault force on Manhattan.
Hundreds of vampire-like monsters with bronze legs serving in Kronos's invasion force.
Packs of large demon dogs from the Underworld serving in Kronos's army.

16.description: Wild centaurs led by Chiron who arrive to help defend Manhattan and Olympus.
Dryads, satyrs, and other nature spirits led by Grover who join the final battle.

6.description: Immortal huntresses led by Thalia Grace who join the battle to defend Olympus.

5.description: Head counselors from all the different cabins who help coordinate the defense of Manhattan.

8.description: All available campers from Camp Half-Blood mobilized to defend Manhattan and Olympus.

2.description: Ancient Titan of the ocean fighting Poseidon in underwater battles while the main war rages on land.

17.description: Finally defeated by Poseidon, allowing the sea god to join the final battle on land.

16.description: Army of cyclopes led by Tyson who arrive to help in the final battle with their strength and crafting skills.

17.description: Goddess of wisdom who joins the final battle against Kronos and the Titans.

22.description: Agrees to Percy's request to claim all godly children and build cabins for minor gods.

17.description: God of messengers who joins the final battle, conflicted about his son Luke's betrayal.

21.description: Grieves for Luke after his son's heroic sacrifice to destroy Kronos.

17.description: God of the sun, music, and healing who joins the final battle with his golden arrows and divine power.

6.description: Goddess of the hunt who leads her Hunters in the final battle against the Titans.

17.description: God of wine who joins the final battle, fighting with vines and his divine madness powers.
Goddess of love and beauty who joins the final battle, using her charmspeak and divine powers.
Goddess of the harvest who uses her power over plants and nature in the final battle.
God of fire and metalworking who provides weapons and joins the final battle with his mechanical creations.

22.description: Various minor gods and goddesses who finally receive recognition and cabins at Camp Half-Blood.

9.description: Goddess of revenge and balance, mother to Ethan Nakamura who fights for the Titans.

22.description: Receives a cabin at Camp Half-Blood as part of Percy's request for all gods to claim their children.
Goddess of magic who receives a cabin at Camp Half-Blood for her demigod children.

8.description: Goddess of the rainbow who continues providing communication services during the battle.

7.description: God of sleep who works with Morpheus to keep Manhattan's mortals asleep during the battle.

22.description: Roman god of doorways and beginnings who receives recognition as the gods honor all deities.
Roman god of boundaries mentioned among the minor deities receiving new recognition.

8.description: Demigods who joined Kronos's cause, believing the Titans offer a better future than the neglectful Olympians.
Firefighters, paramedics, and other emergency workers in Manhattan who fall asleep due to Morpheus's spell.
Military personnel stationed around Manhattan who are also affected by the sleep spell.

17.description: The famous statue temporarily animated by divine power during the climactic battle.
The skyscraper that serves as the entrance to Mount Olympus via its secret 600th floor.

12.description: Major Manhattan bridge that becomes a battleground during the Titan invasion.

14.description: Art Deco skyscraper that serves as a vantage point and battle site during the Manhattan conflict.

13.description: Another major bridge connecting Manhattan that becomes part of the battle theater.

16.description: Large Manhattan park that becomes a staging area and battle site, with nature spirits joining the fight.

4.description: The invulnerability curse Percy received from bathing in the River Styx, with Annabeth as his anchor.

20.description: The curse that protects Percy throughout the final battle but also makes him vulnerable at his anchor point.

recaps.1: Percy Jackson turns sixteen, the age mentioned in the Great Prophecy. He and Charles Beckendorf plan a dangerous mission to destroy Kronos's ship, the Princess Andromeda.
recaps.2: Percy and Beckendorf successfully infiltrate and destroy Kronos's cruise ship, but Beckendorf sacrifices himself in the explosion. Percy barely escapes and returns to camp with devastating news.
recaps.3: Nico di Angelo visits Percy and explains the curse of Achilles - bathing in the River Styx to become invulnerable except for one weak spot. Percy considers this desperate measure.
recaps.4: Percy travels to the Underworld with Nico and bathes in the River Styx, gaining the curse of Achilles. Annabeth becomes his mortal anchor, the connection that keeps him human.
recaps.5: Percy returns to Camp Half-Blood with his new invulnerability as Kronos's forces prepare for their final assault. Rachel, now the Oracle, gives warnings about the coming battle.
recaps.6: The gods are revealed to be fighting their own battles against the ancient Titans in other realms, leaving Olympus largely undefended. The demigods must protect both Manhattan and Olympus.
recaps.7: Kronos's army approaches Manhattan as the demigods set up defensive positions throughout the city. Percy leads the coordination of various allied forces.
recaps.8: The battle for Manhattan begins in earnest as Kronos, possessing Luke's body, leads monsters and rogue demigods against the defenders. The fighting is fierce and desperate.
recaps.9: The battle intensifies as both sides suffer heavy casualties. Percy's invulnerability helps him survive otherwise fatal attacks, but the enemy forces seem overwhelming.
recaps.10: Various gods' children from minor cabins join the fight, including some who had been fighting for Kronos. The tide of battle shifts back and forth through the streets of Manhattan.
recaps.11: The defenders make strategic retreats through the city while maintaining key defensive positions. Percy coordinates with Thalia, Annabeth, and other leaders to organize the resistance.
recaps.12: Kronos advances toward the Empire State Building and the entrance to Olympus. The final phase of the battle approaches as the defenders make their last stand.
recaps.13: Luke's original personality occasionally breaks through Kronos's control, giving hope that he might still be saved. The battle reaches the base of Olympus itself.
recaps.14: Kronos demonstrates his full power, causing reality to warp around him. The defenders struggle against his overwhelming might as he approaches the throne room of the gods.
recaps.15: The Ares cabin initially refuses to fight due to ongoing conflicts, weakening the defense. Personal rivalries threaten to doom the entire effort.
recaps.16: Annabeth is seriously wounded by a poisoned blade, motivating Percy to fight even more desperately. Nico arrives with reinforcements from the Underworld.
recaps.17: The gods finally return from their own battles to help in the final confrontation. Silena Beauregard is revealed as Luke's spy but dies heroically trying to redeem herself.
recaps.18: Clarisse returns with the Ares cabin to join the final battle after her boyfriend is wounded. Their arrival helps turn the tide against Kronos's remaining forces.
recaps.19: The final confrontation takes place in Olympus itself as Kronos faces the returned gods and the remaining heroes. Ethan Nakamura dies trying to stop the Titan lord.
recaps.20: Percy realizes the prophecy refers to Luke, not himself. Luke finds the strength to take control from Kronos and stabs his own mortal point, destroying both himself and the Titan.
recaps.21: Luke dies peacefully after destroying Kronos, finally free from the Titan's influence. The war ends with his redemptive sacrifice, saving both Olympus and the mortal world.
recaps.22: The gods offer Percy immortality as a reward, but he chooses to remain mortal and be with his friends. He requests that all gods claim their children, and Zeus agrees to this demand.
recaps.23: Camp Half-Blood begins expanding to accommodate children of all gods, including minor ones. Percy and Annabeth finally become a couple, and a new era of peace begins for the demigod world.
